subject: Management
title: Feedback and Growth
description: A 60-second lesson on Feedback and Growth.

hook.text: A surgeon improved her outcomes 26% in one year. Her secret: she watched her own surgery videos.

buildup.text: Without feedback, people repeat mistakes. They can't see what they can't see.

discovery.text: Anders Ericsson's deliberate practice: improvement requires clear feedback on what to change.

twist.text: Talent without feedback plateaus. Modest ability with great feedback compounds into mastery.

climax.text: Seek feedback on specific skills. Apply it immediately. Then seek more. That's the growth loop.

punchline.text: Feedback is the fuel of growth. Without it, talent idles.

quiz.question: Why is feedback essential for professional growth?
options: Without it, people can't see their blind spots and repeat the same mistakes
Talented people don't need feedback to improve naturally
Feedback only matters during the first year of a new job
